metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4199 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
vm-support 0.88 in VMware Tools, as distributed with VMware Workstation through 10.0.3 and other products, allows local users to write to arbitrary files via a symlink attack on a file in /tmp.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4199` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

open-vm-tools - 2:11.0.5-4ubuntu0.18.04.1
open-vm-tools-desktop - 2:11.0.5-4ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: open-vm-tools package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:11.0.5-4ubuntu0.18.04.1').
